revised_title: Magnetic Screening and the Neutralizing Power of Iron
tldr: This article investigates the influence of screens in arresting the progress of magnetic action and the power of masses of iron to control the attractive force of a magnet. The author, William Snow Harris, demonstrates that every substance susceptible of magnetism by induction tends to arrest the action of a magnet upon a third substance. He also explores the neutralizing power of iron and suggests that substances highly susceptible of receiving transient magnetism are the most efficient in their operation as screens.
